input: Anne is cold. Anne is furry. Anne is red. Dave is young. Gary is nice. Gary is young. Harry is not blue. All nice people are red. All furry people are blue. All furry, red people are quiet. Blue people are cold. Young people are cold. Cold people are furry. If Dave is blue then Dave is red. If Gary is furry then Gary is nice. Question: Dave is not quiet.?
output:
universe u

constant obj : Type u

constant Anne : obj
constant Dave : obj
constant Gary : obj
constant Harry : obj

constant Cold : obj → Prop
constant Furry : obj → Prop
constant Red : obj → Prop
constant Young : obj → Prop
constant Nice : obj → Prop
constant Blue : obj → Prop
constant Quiet : obj → Prop

axiom T1 : Cold Anne
axiom T2 : Furry Anne
axiom T3 : Red Anne
axiom T4 : Young Dave
axiom T5 : Nice Gary
axiom T6 : Young Gary
axiom T7 : ¬ Blue Harry

axiom R1 : ∀ x : obj, Nice x → Red x
axiom R2 : ∀ x : obj, Furry x → Blue x
axiom R3 : ∀ x : obj, Furry x ∧ Red x → Quiet x
axiom R4 : ∀ x : obj, Blue x → Cold x
axiom R5 : ∀ x : obj, Young x → Cold x
axiom R6 : ∀ x : obj, Cold x → Furry x
axiom R7 : ∀ x : obj, Blue Dave → Red Dave
axiom R8 : ∀ x : obj, Furry Gary → Nice Gary

theorem dave_is_not_quiet : ¬ Quiet Dave :=
begin
  intro H,
  have H1 : Furry Dave, from R6 (R5 T4),
  have H2 : Red Dave, from R1 (R8 Gary H1),
  have H3 : Quiet Dave, from R3 Dave ⟨H1, H2⟩,
  contradiction,
end

-- The answer is True
